alert.note: Alert for Genesee; Monroe (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 6:36AM EST until February 19 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New York... Black Creek At Churchville affecting Monroe and Genesee Counties. .Heavy rain will fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and reach critical levels. For the Black Creek...including Churchville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black Creek At Churchville. * WHEN...From late tonight to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flood stage, more widespread agricultural land flooding, some backyard and basement flooding Churchville to Chili but minimal damages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM EST Friday the stage was 4.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 6.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.4 feet on 05/07/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 645 PM EST.
